title: Numbers Chapter 31 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Numbers chapter 31 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Numbers Chapter 31 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Numbers Chapter 31.

questions.question: Who did the LORD command Moses to avenge in Numbers 31?
questions.correctAnswer: The Midianites
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:2 states, 'Avenge the children of Israel of the Midianites.'

questions.question: How many men from each tribe were sent to war against the Midianites?
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:4 says, 'Of every tribe a thousand, throughout all the tribes of Israel, shall ye send to the war.'

questions.question: Who accompanied the warriors to battle with the holy instruments and trumpets?
questions.correctAnswer: Phinehas son of Eleazar
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:6 states, 'And Moses sent them to the war ... and Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, to the war, with the holy instruments, and the trumpets to blow in his hand.'

questions.question: What did the children of Israel do to the cities of Midian after the battle?
options: Burnt all their cities and castles
questions.correctAnswer: Burnt all their cities and castles
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:10 says, 'And they burnt all their cities wherein they dwelt, and all their goodly castles, with fire.'

questions.question: Which kings of Midian were slain by the Israelites?
questions.correctAnswer: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, Reba
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:8 lists these five kings of Midian slain by the Israelites.

questions.question: What did Moses say to the officers regarding the women they had brought back?
options: Have ye saved all the women alive?
Bring all women to the camp
questions.correctAnswer: Have ye saved all the women alive?
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:15 shows Moses' anger and question, 'Have ye saved all the women alive?'

questions.question: According to Moses, why should certain women be killed?
options: Because they caused Israel to sin through Balaam's counsel
Because they were from a hostile tribe
questions.correctAnswer: Because they caused Israel to sin through Balaam's counsel
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:16 states, 'these caused the children of Israel ... to commit trespass against the LORD in the matter of Peor.'

questions.question: How long were the Israelites to remain outside the camp for purification?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven days
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:19 instructs, 'And do ye abide without the camp seven days.'

questions.question: Which materials were to be purified by fire according to the law given to the men of war?
options: Gold, silver, brass, iron, tin, and lead
questions.correctAnswer: Gold, silver, brass, iron, tin, and lead
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:22 specifies these metals for purification by fire.

questions.question: What was the tribute to the LORD from the men of war who went to battle?
questions.correctAnswer: One soul of five hundred
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:28 commands a tribute of one soul in five hundred from persons and animals.

questions.question: How many sheep were taken as booty by the men of war?
questions.correctAnswer: Six hundred seventy-five thousand
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:32 states the booty included 675,000 sheep.

questions.question: True or False: The children of Israel were commanded to keep all the women captives alive regardless of their condition.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:17-18 orders to kill every male child and every woman who has known man, but to keep alive the women children who have not known man.

questions.question: True or False: Moses and Eleazar took the tribute of gold from the captains and brought it into the tabernacle as a memorial to the LORD.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:54 confirms Moses and Eleazar brought the gold into the tabernacle as a memorial.

questions.question: True or False: The officers confirmed to Moses that no man was missing from those who went to war.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:49 records the officers saying, 'there lacketh not one man of us.'

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'And Moses spake unto the people, saying, Arm some of yourselves unto the ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: war
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:3 states, 'Arm some of yourselves unto the war.'

medium.title: Numbers Chapter 31 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Numbers Chapter 31 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with obedience in difficult circumstances. Based on Numbers 31, what biblical truth would you share about obedience to God's commands?
options: Obedience to God's commands leads to His blessing and guidance.
Obedience is optional when the situation is hard.
God's commands are only suggestions to consider.
One should obey only when it benefits personally.
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience to God's commands leads to His blessing and guidance.
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:1-7 shows how Moses obeyed God's command to avenge Israel against Midian, leading to victory and fulfillment of God's will. This teaches that faithful obedience, even in hard tasks, aligns us with God's purposes.

questions.question: How does Numbers 31 teach us about integrity and honesty in handling spoils or possessions?
options: All spoils must be accounted for and properly divided according to God's instructions.
Taking spoils secretly is acceptable if no one knows.
Each person can keep whatever they want without reporting.
Spoils can be divided arbitrarily without rules.
questions.correctAnswer: All spoils must be accounted for and properly divided according to God's instructions.
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:26-47 instructs Moses and Eleazar to take a census of the spoils and divide them carefully, including tithes and offerings to the Lord, illustrating the importance of integrity and stewardship.

questions.question: A believer asks how to deal with temptation and sinfulness in the community. What practical lesson does Numbers 31 provide?
options: Sinful influences must be removed to protect the community’s holiness.
Ignore sin and hope it resolves itself.
Accept sin as part of life without consequences.
questions.correctAnswer: Sinful influences must be removed to protect the community’s holiness.
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:15-18 shows Moses instructing the killing of women who had led Israel into sin, emphasizing the principle of removing sinful influences to maintain purity and obedience to God.

questions.question: What does Numbers 31 teach about the role of spiritual leadership in guiding the people?
options: Spiritual leaders must enforce God’s commands and oversee proper worship and purity.
Leaders should avoid difficult decisions to keep peace.
Leadership is only about managing resources, not spiritual matters.
Spiritual guidance is optional for leaders.
questions.correctAnswer: Spiritual leaders must enforce God’s commands and oversee proper worship and purity.
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:6 and 21-22 show Eleazar the priest participating in war and instructing purification, demonstrating the leadership role in enforcing God’s laws and maintaining holiness.

questions.question: How does Numbers 31 encourage believers in stewardship and generosity?
options: Believers should give a portion of their gains as offerings to God and support the work of the ministry.
Keep all your gains for personal use only.
Giving is unnecessary if you work hard.
Offerings to God are optional and not important.
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should give a portion of their gains as offerings to God and support the work of the ministry.
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:28-30 and 41-47 describe the required tribute and offerings from the spoils to the Lord and the Levites, teaching the importance of faithful giving and supporting God’s work.

questions.question: A believer is going through trials and asks for counsel on perseverance. What truth from Numbers 31 could you share?
options: Trust and obey God’s commands even when facing difficult challenges.
Give up if the situation becomes too hard.
Rely on your own strength without God’s help.
questions.correctAnswer: Trust and obey God’s commands even when facing difficult challenges.
questions.explanation: The Israelite warriors trusted God's command to battle Midian (Numbers 31:3-7) and obeyed faithfully, showing the importance of perseverance through faith and obedience.

questions.question: How does Numbers 31 model the virtue of humility in leadership?
options: Moses involved priests and leaders and submitted to God's instructions.
questions.correctAnswer: Moses involved priests and leaders and submitted to God's instructions.
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:6, 12-13 show Moses involving Eleazar the priest and the princes in handling the spoils and meeting the army, illustrating humble and accountable leadership under God’s direction.

questions.question: True or False: According to Numbers 31, it is acceptable to keep women who caused Israel to sin.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:15-17 commands killing every woman who had known man to prevent further sin, emphasizing the seriousness of guarding the community’s purity.

questions.question: True or False: The officers reported that no soldiers were missing after the battle in Numbers 31.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:49 records the officers confirming to Moses that all the men of war were accounted for, showing faithfulness and responsibility in their duties.

questions.question: How does Numbers 31 teach about spiritual discipline related to purification?
options: Purification through washing and following God’s ordinances is necessary after battle.
No purification is needed after war.
Purification is a private matter without guidelines.
questions.correctAnswer: Purification through washing and following God’s ordinances is necessary after battle.
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:19-24 shows detailed instructions on purification for those who touched the slain or killed, emphasizing spiritual discipline and holiness.

questions.question: A believer asks how to maintain contentment after achieving victory. What lesson from Numbers 31 can you share?
options: Give thanks to God and share the blessings by offering a portion for His service.
Keep all the victory spoils without sharing.
Ignore God’s role in your victory.
questions.correctAnswer: Give thanks to God and share the blessings by offering a portion for His service.
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:41-47 describes Moses and Eleazar giving the Lord’s heave offering and portions to the Levites, teaching gratitude through stewardship and generosity.

questions.question: How does the chapter illustrate the importance of faith when facing enemies?
options: Faith in God’s command leads to victory and protection.
questions.correctAnswer: Faith in God’s command leads to victory and protection.
questions.explanation: The Israelites followed God’s command through Moses to battle Midian (Numbers 31:3-7), relying on divine guidance for victory, showing faith as essential in trials.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Numbers 31:6, Moses sent the army to war with ________ in the hand for blowing.
questions.correctAnswer: trumpets
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:6 specifies that Phinehas carried the holy instruments and trumpets to blow during the war.

questions.question: How can Numbers 31 guide a believer in practicing justice within the church community?
options: Justice involves following God’s laws impartially, even when discipline is hard.
Justice can be ignored for convenience.
Justice is only for outsiders, not the community.
questions.correctAnswer: Justice involves following God’s laws impartially, even when discipline is hard.
questions.explanation: Moses’ anger with officers for sparing women who caused sin (Numbers 31:14-17) shows the necessity of impartial justice according to God’s commands to protect the community.

questions.question: What does Numbers 31 teach about the importance of prayer and seeking God’s will in challenging tasks?
options: God’s instructions through Moses guided the army’s actions, showing reliance on divine direction.
Planning alone is sufficient without God’s guidance.
Ignore God’s will and proceed independently.
questions.correctAnswer: God’s instructions through Moses guided the army’s actions, showing reliance on divine direction.
questions.explanation: The chapter begins with the LORD speaking to Moses with clear commands (Numbers 31:1-3), teaching the importance of seeking and following God’s will in challenges.

hard.title: Numbers Chapter 31 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Numbers Chapter 31.

questions.question: What was the specific instruction God gave Moses regarding the Midianites in Numbers 31?
options: Avenge the children of Israel of the Midianites
Invite the Midianites to the camp
questions.correctAnswer: Avenge the children of Israel of the Midianites
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:2 records God's command to Moses to avenge the children of Israel against the Midianites, signaling a divinely sanctioned military action.

questions.question: How many men were sent from each tribe of Israel to fight against the Midianites?
questions.correctAnswer: One thousand
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:4 specifies that a thousand men from each tribe were to be sent to war, totaling twelve thousand armed men, illustrating a structured military mobilization.

questions.question: Who accompanied the Israelite soldiers to war carrying the holy instruments and trumpets?
options: Phinehas, son of Eleazar the priest
questions.correctAnswer: Phinehas, son of Eleazar the priest
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:6 notes that Phinehas accompanied the troops with the holy instruments and trumpets, emphasizing the priestly role in the warfare ritual.

questions.question: Which king of Midian, known for his role in tempting Israel, was killed in this battle?
questions.correctAnswer: Balaam, son of Beor
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:8 highlights Balaam's death, a significant figure who previously counseled Balak to lead Israel into sin, thus his killing symbolizes judgment on his corrupt influence.

questions.question: What was done to the cities and castles of the Midianites after the battle?
options: They were given to the Levites
questions.correctAnswer: They were burned with fire
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:10 states all the Midianite cities and castles were burned, reflecting a total destruction to prevent future threat and fulfill divine judgment.

questions.question: Why was Moses angry with the officers who returned from battle with the captives?
options: Because they had saved all the women alive
Because they did not bring enough spoils
questions.correctAnswer: Because they had saved all the women alive
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:14-15 shows Moses' anger as the officers spared the women, who were seen as a cause of Israel's earlier sin through Balaam's counsel.

questions.question: According to Numbers 31, which women were to be kept alive by the Israelites?
options: Women who had not known a man by lying with him
questions.correctAnswer: Women who had not known a man by lying with him
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:18 instructs to keep alive female children who were virgins, distinguishing them from those who had known men, emphasizing ritual purity and lineage preservation.

questions.question: What purification ritual was commanded after the battle for those who had killed or touched the dead?
options: To purify themselves on the third and seventh days
To go without water for three days
questions.correctAnswer: To purify themselves on the third and seventh days
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:19 directs purification on the third and seventh days for those who had contact with the dead, reflecting ancient Israel's laws on ritual cleanliness.

questions.question: What metals were to be purified by fire according to the priest Eleazar's instruction?
options: Gold, silver, brass, iron, tin, and lead
Gold, silver, copper, bronze, iron, and tin
Gold, silver, bronze, iron, and bronze
Gold, silver, brass, copper, and tin
questions.correctAnswer: Gold, silver, brass, iron, tin, and lead
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:22 lists these metals as those that may endure fire and thus must be purified by fire, indicating an early ritual for cleansing valuable materials.

questions.question: What was the ratio of war spoils to be levied as a tribute to the LORD from the men who went out to battle?
questions.correctAnswer: One soul of five hundred
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:28 commands a tithe of one in five hundred from the war spoils to be given as a tribute to the LORD, reflecting a sacred tax system for dedication.

questions.question: To whom was the LORD's heave offering from the tribute given?
questions.correctAnswer: Eleazar the priest
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:29-41 shows that the tribute was given to Eleazar the priest as a heave offering, indicating the priestly role in managing sacred gifts.

questions.question: How were the spoils of war divided between the men who fought and the rest of the congregation?
options: Given only to Moses and priests
questions.correctAnswer: Equally into two parts
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:27 instructs to divide the spoil into two equal parts between the men who fought and the entire congregation, suggesting communal sharing of resources.

questions.question: What did the officers of the host bring to Moses as an oblation for the LORD after the battle?
options: Jewels of gold, chains, bracelets, rings, earrings, and tablets
questions.correctAnswer: Jewels of gold, chains, bracelets, rings, earrings, and tablets
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:50 records the officers bringing gold ornaments and precious items for atonement, showing a voluntary dedication for their souls.

questions.question: The killing of the Midianite men and selective sparing of women in Numbers 31 foreshadows which New Testament theme?
options: Judgment and redemption through separation of the holy
questions.correctAnswer: Judgment and redemption through separation of the holy
questions.explanation: This event typifies God's judgment on sin and the preservation of what is holy (Numbers 31:17-18), paralleling New Testament themes of sanctification and separation.

questions.question: True or False: The Israelites were commanded to purify not only themselves but also their raiment and all that was made of skins and wood after the battle.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:20 clearly commands purification of clothing and items made from skins, goats' hair, and wood, highlighting comprehensive ritual cleansing.

theological.title: Numbers Chapter 31 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Numbers Chapter 31 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What command did the LORD give to Moses regarding the Midianites in Numbers 31?
options: To make peace with the Midianites
To avenge the children of Israel of the Midianites
To form an alliance with the Midianites
questions.correctAnswer: To avenge the children of Israel of the Midianites
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:2 records God commanding Moses to avenge Israel against the Midianites. This shows God's justice in defending His people, consistent with His holy judgment against sin (Exodus 15:3; Deuteronomy 32:35; Romans 12:19; Hebrews 10:30).

questions.question: How many men from each tribe were sent to war against Midian?
questions.correctAnswer: 1000 from each tribe
questions.explanation: According to Numbers 31:4-5, Moses sent a thousand men from each tribe, totaling twelve thousand armed men. This reflects God's orderly leadership and the role of the community in carrying out His commands (Exodus 18:21; Joshua 1:14; 1 Chronicles 12:23; Hebrews 13:7).

questions.question: Who accompanied the Israelite army to war, holding the holy instruments and trumpets?
options: Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest
questions.correctAnswer: Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:6 states Phinehas went with the army carrying holy instruments and trumpets, emphasizing the priestly role in spiritual warfare and God's presence with His people (Exodus 28:1; Leviticus 10:11; Psalm 20:6; Hebrews 7:22).

questions.question: What was the outcome of the Israelite battle against the Midianites?
options: They made a treaty with Midian
They slew all the males and kings of Midian
questions.correctAnswer: They slew all the males and kings of Midian
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:7-8 shows that the Israelites killed all the Midianite males including their five kings and Balaam. This demonstrates God's judgment against sin and idolatry, consistent with Old Testament divine justice (Deuteronomy 20:16-18; Joshua 6:21; 2 Chronicles 20:15; Revelation 19:11-15).

questions.question: Why did Moses become angry with the officers of the army after the battle?
options: Because they took too much spoil
Because they saved all the women alive
Because they disobeyed regarding the cattle
questions.correctAnswer: Because they saved all the women alive
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:14-15 shows Moses' anger because the officers spared the women, who had caused Israel to sin through Balaam's counsel. This illustrates God's hatred of sin and the need for holiness (Psalm 5:4-6; Proverbs 6:16-19; 1 Corinthians 5:6-7; 2 Corinthians 6:17).

questions.question: According to God's command, which women were to be kept alive after the battle?
options: Women who had not known a man by lying with him
questions.correctAnswer: Women who had not known a man by lying with him
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:18 commands to keep alive only the virgin women, showing God's concern for purity and the preservation of life aligned with His holiness (Leviticus 21:7; Deuteronomy 22:13-21; 1 Corinthians 7:34; Hebrews 13:4).

questions.question: What purification process was commanded for those who killed or touched the slain?
options: Abstain from food for three days
Purify on the third and seventh day and wash clothes
questions.correctAnswer: Purify on the third and seventh day and wash clothes
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:19-24 prescribes purification on the third and seventh day and washing of clothes, illustrating God's holiness and the need for ceremonial cleansing after contact with death (Leviticus 11:24-40; Numbers 19:11-22; Hebrews 9:13-14; 1 John 1:7).

questions.question: What was the purpose of the tribute levied on the men of war and the spoil?
options: To give a gift to the Midianites
To give an offering to the LORD via Eleazar the priest
questions.correctAnswer: To give an offering to the LORD via Eleazar the priest
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:28-29 explains the tribute was an offering to the LORD, given to Eleazar the priest. This underscores God's ownership over victory and provision, consistent with Old Testament tithe and offering principles (Leviticus 27:30; Deuteronomy 16:16-17; Malachi 3:10; Hebrews 7:1-2).

questions.question: How was the spoil divided between the men of war and the congregation?
options: All to the men of war
questions.correctAnswer: Divided into two equal parts
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:27 states the spoil was divided into two parts between the warriors and the congregation. This reflects God's provision for both the fighters and the community, highlighting corporate responsibility and reward (Joshua 22:8; 1 Samuel 30:24; 1 Corinthians 9:7-14; Philippians 4:15).

questions.question: What was the number of women who had not known a man that were taken captive?
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:35 records 32,000 virgin women captured, showing the scale of the victory and God's preservation of those who were pure (Numbers 31:18; Deuteronomy 21:10-14; Isaiah 61:3; Revelation 14:4).

questions.question: What did the officers of the host bring to Moses as an offering after the battle?
options: Jewels of gold, chains, bracelets, rings, earrings, and tablets
questions.correctAnswer: Jewels of gold, chains, bracelets, rings, earrings, and tablets
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:50-51 shows the officers brought gold jewelry as an oblation to make atonement before the LORD, demonstrating gratitude and acknowledgment of God's blessing (Exodus 35:22; 1 Chronicles 29:3; Psalm 45:9; Romans 12:1).

questions.question: What was done with the gold offered by the captains of thousands and hundreds?
options: Brought into the tabernacle as a memorial
questions.correctAnswer: Brought into the tabernacle as a memorial
questions.explanation: Numbers 31:54 states the gold was brought into the tabernacle as a memorial before the LORD, signifying worship and remembrance of God's deliverance (Exodus 25:11; Leviticus 8:9; Psalm 115:1; Hebrews 10:25).

questions.question: What theological theme is illustrated by God's command to kill the Midianite men and certain women?
options: God's holiness and judgment against sin
questions.correctAnswer: God's holiness and judgment against sin
questions.explanation: God's command to destroy the Midianite males and unclean women (Numbers 31:7-18) reflects His holiness and righteous judgment against sin, consistent with His character revealed throughout Scripture (Isaiah 6:3; Romans 1:18; Revelation 15:4; Psalm 7:11).

questions.question: How does Numbers 31 connect to the greater biblical narrative of salvation?
options: By showing Israel’s failure to obey God
By illustrating God’s judgment and the need for holiness
By teaching about the end times
By emphasizing human effort over divine grace
questions.correctAnswer: By illustrating God’s judgment and the need for holiness
questions.explanation: Numbers 31 shows God's judgment on sin and the call to holiness, which points forward to Christ's perfect holiness and ultimate judgment of sin (Leviticus 19:2; Hebrews 12:14; 1 Peter 1:16; Revelation 20:11-15).

questions.question: What attribute of God is revealed through His instructions for purification after the battle?
questions.correctAnswer: God’s holiness and justice
questions.explanation: The purification rituals in Numbers 31:19-24 reveal God's holiness, requiring separation from defilement, and His justice, maintaining the community’s purity (Leviticus 10:3; Isaiah 6:5-7; 1 Peter 1:15-16; Revelation 21:27).

questions.question: What role did Eleazar the priest play in the events of Numbers 31?
options: He led the army into battle
He administered the holy instruments and received offerings
questions.correctAnswer: He administered the holy instruments and received offerings
questions.explanation: Eleazar, son of Aaron, acted as priest overseeing holy instruments in battle and received offerings and tribute (Numbers 31:6, 26-29, 41, 51), underscoring the priest’s mediatory role, consistent with Old Testament priesthood and foreshadowing Christ as High Priest (Hebrews 7:23-28; Exodus 28:1; Leviticus 10:10).
